section.heading: Definitions.
section.text: For the purposes of this subchapter, the term:

para.text: “DCPS” means the District of Columbia Public Schools, established by § 38-171.
“Excess” means no longer needed for operational purposes for DCPS or another District agency.
“School facility” means a structure or real property that:
Is under the control of DCPS; or
Was previously under the control of DCPS or the Board of Education and is now under the control of the Mayor or another agency of the District government.
“Significantly underused” means a DCPS facility that is used primarily for administrative purposes and uses less than 25% of the property’s available square footage on a daily basis.
“Swing space” means a school facility reserved for future classroom instruction or DCPS administrative use during planned renovation, modernization, or construction of another school facility.
“Utilization” means the ratio of current enrollment to the total number of students that can be served in a space based on programmatic and scheduling requirements.

annotations.annotation: as added June 21, 2014, D.C. Law 20-114, § 3(a), 61 DCR 4669
